captions.text: Hi, how are you doing?! My name is Otário (Sucker)!

Tax collection, public debt,
government stimulus packages, world cup,
money deviation, finally, in newspapers and magazines it's very common to see values around billions
or even trillions reais!

- But what this all means? (visually 
speaking)

- Do you have idea of the volume of money that 1
1 million reais represents?

- Would you be able to store these values in
your underpants (or panties)?
- And what about 1 billion reais?
- Does it fit in the trunk of a car?
- And what about 1 trillion reais?
Let's start with a R$100 reais bill

That can be stored in any wallet
or even inside a book.
A package with 100 (one-hundred) bills of R$100 reais has around 1cm thick
and contains R$ 10.000 reais.

It fits in your pocket easily and, according
to DIEESE, this value would be enough

to sustain around 4 families for
1 month.
Believe it or not, this small pile of money you see now, contains R$ 1 million reais
You could put this amount in a grocery bag
Like the one I use in my head!
And walk with it on the street ;-)
But while R$1.000.000 (1 million reais)
seems a little inexpressive (visually speaking), R$ 100 millions is a little more respectable.
It fits perfectly in a pallet
of 1 meter wide by 1 meter long
Actually, to be precise, in this block we have R$ 100.800.000
but I will despise the 800.000 to simplify the math ;-)

This picture, represents 1 billion reais
(R$1.000.000.000 or 10 x R$100.000.000)...
now it's getting interesting... huh?!
And here, we have 10 Billion reais (R$10.000.000.000)...
notice the size compared to the money!
If this was put in a racecourse

it would be possible run 100 meters over
a pile of money of 1 meter wide and
almost 96 centimeters deep.
- So? Are you excited to see what would be 1 trillion reais!? (R$1.000.000.000.000)
- Ready?
- Will that surprise you? ;-)
So, i present you R$ 1 trillion reais...
- Woooow, that's cooooool!
If the money was put in a pallet on top of another
give a height of 9600 meters, what would be bigger than Mount Everest
or about 22 times the size of Empire States Building (in USA) ;-)
And just to remember that these bills are of R$100 reais
'cause if we has bills of R$50, we would have to multiply all by 2 ;-)
So, next time you hear those numbers...
have these pictures in mind.
And let no fucking politician fool you.
I guess that, now, when you hear any news of any fucking politician put his hand in your money
You will have a better idea of what this means
Oh, just out of curiosity, in 2012 and 2013, the government collected about twice this in taxes!
You are kidding me, huh?!
[ Translation - Vitor Utrila ]

title: Qual o volume de 1 trilhão de reais?! @CanalDoOtario
